result.execSummary:
The defendant Elmer A Borske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Elmer A Borske is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Elmer A Borske was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond previously posted in the amount of $500.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Fine is to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Same repayment provisions apply as noted above for the Fine.

Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges granted.    Pursuant to s. 346.65(7), Wis. Stats., Defendant shall be required to remain in the County Jail for not less than a 48 consecutive hour period prior to release for huber.
Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Case Called w/Citations @ 1:50 PM: Defendant Elmer A Borske in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA states dual offers were extended by letter of 4/27/16.  Joint resolution has been reached and DA recites same.  Def confirms State's recital.    Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea Ct 2 (RCS 2):  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Ct 1 dismissed outright.  16TR-556 and 16TR-557 both DRI.  Statement by Def prior to SEH:  Yes.   The Court:  Court encourages Def to contact DHS in FDL Co for assistance with grief counseling. Accepts resolution reached.  Imposes 12 days WCJ, Huber and GT, Report: 8/1/2016 - 1 day TS credit; 48 hr requirement prior to release for Huber ordered; $1555 Fine, bond to be applied with $42.50 Blood Draw Fee; 12 Mos DL Rev/IID/OWI assessment prior to relicensing; Def encouraged to get an OCC DL as soon as possible to run in alignment with Rev period; DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.

Pre-trial conference on May 26, 2016 at 10:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.   No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Case Called @ 3:31 PM: Defendant Elmer A Borske in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  ADA serves AC - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel - not employed - requests add'l time to obtain counsel.  Def referred to SPD for eligibility.  Def requests to speak with the State without counsel.  Court accepts waiver of counsel to allow for discussions  with the State.  NGP entered by Court.   PTC and P/S Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 10:15 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
